titles.title: Religious Communication Sanctity Act of 1997
To amend title 18, United States Code, to protect the sanctity of religious communications.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Religious Communication Sanctity Act of 1997 - Amends the Federal criminal code to impose penalties upon persons who, under color of governmental authority, surreptitiously listen to or record any communication that is privileged because of its religious character. Authorizes any person aggrieved by a violation consisting of the recording of a communication to obtain, in a civil action, the prompt destruction of that recording and any copies or transcripts made from such recording.
